City Council
============

* [Meeting Rules](http://sanmarcostx.gov/411/Council-Meetings-Rules)

* [Request a Proclamation](http://www.sanmarcostx.gov/331/Proclamation-Request-Form-Schedule)

* [Agendas & Minutes](http://www.sanmarcostx.gov/AgendaCenter/City-Council-4)

* [City Elections](https://www.sanmarcostx.gov/4110/City-of-San-Marcos-Elections)

* [Email City Council](mailto:councilmembers@sanmarcostx.gov)

* [Council Message Board](https://councilforum.sanmarcostx.gov/index.php)

City Council Meetings
---------------------

City council members meet on the first and third Tuesdays of each month. For questions, please [email the City Council](mailto:councilmembers@sanmarcostx.gov).

### 2025 City Council Meeting Calendar

The [2026 City Council Meeting Calendar (PDF)](https://www.sanmarcostx.gov/DocumentCenter/View/45519/2026-FINAL-Council-Calendar)is available for download. Please note dates are subject to change due to unforeseen conflicts with Council/Staff schedules or venue availability.

### Meeting Schedule

* 3:00 p.m. - City Council Work Session and Executive Session\*
* 6:00 p.m. - City Council Regular Meeting \*
* City Hall  
  City Council Chambers  
  630 E Hopkins  
  San Marcos, TX 78666

![Amanda Rodriguez](https://www.sanmarcostx.gov/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=42859)

The San Marcos City Council is composed of a Mayor elected at-large by the people for a 2-year term and 6 Council Members elected at-large for staggered 3-year terms. Regular City Council elections are held on the general election day in November.

Responsibilities
----------------

The Council enacts policies, adopts ordinances and resolutions, establishes the annual budget to provide services to the public, and sets the city tax rate, and water, electric and wastewater rates for San Marcos.

The City Council operates under the City Charter adopted by the citizens of San Marcos.
